revised_title: Tracing the Coupling Patterns of Axon-Bearing Horizontal Cells in Mammalian Retina
tldr: The author investigated the coupling patterns of axon-bearing horizontal cells in the mammalian retina, specifically in rabbit retina, using Neurobiotin as a tracer. They discovered that B-type horizontal cells show strong tracer coupling between their dendritic trees and axonal arborizations, suggesting that these cells are electrically coupled. This finding establishes a similarity in coupling patterns between axon-bearing horizontal cells in mammalian and non-mammalian retinae.
